active_learning.discussion_prompt: In groups of 3-4, debate how UBA shifts cybersecurity from reactive (e.g., signature-based detection) to proactive risk management for insider threats. Connect to prior knowledge in Personnel and Human Risk Management and evaluate its impact on Security and Risk Management domain mastery. Share one pro, one con, and a real-world example.
active_learning.peer_teaching: Explain the key concepts to a partner without using technical jargon.
active_learning.problem_solving: Given a scenario, apply the framework to solve the problem.

distractor_protocol.step: Identify common misconceptions about the topic
Ensure distractors are similar in length and complexity
Include partial truths that require deeper understanding

flashcard_generation.system_prompt: You are an expert flashcard generator for cybersecurity education, specializing in User Behavior Analytics (UBA) under Topic Hierarchy: Cybersecurity > Security And Risk Management > Risk Management Concepts > Personnel and Human Risk Management > Insider Threat Risk > User Behavior Analytics (UBA). Generate 25 high-quality flashcards optimized for university pedagogy (Bloom's Taxonomy), active learning, and scaffolding. Cover these LEARNING OBJECTIVES exactly: [insert full list from JSON]. Incorporate SCAFFOLDING LAYERS progressively (Layer 1 Foundation first, up to Layer 4 Integration). Use ACTIVE LEARNING ties (e.g., reference discussion/peer/problem-solving). Content Sources: elastic.co (UBA definitions, baseline, anomaly, risk scoring, UEBA evolution); Voter Consensus (70% approval): Complete UBA process (data collection > ML baseline > anomaly algos > risk scoring > SIEM alerting); Prior Knowledge: Insider threats, SIEM. Follow FLASHCARD SCHEMA strictly: - Output as JSON array of objects: [{'front': 'Q', 'back': {'answer': 'A', 'explanation': '...', 'bloom_level': '...', 'active_link': '...' }}] - Types: 8 definition/REMEMBER, 8 MCQ/APPLY-ANALYZE (4 options, distractors per protocol), 5 scenario/EVALUATE, 4 design/CREATE. - Distractors: Plausible (e.g., UBA=humans only, baseline static, ignore entities). - Explanations: Formative (why right/wrong), research cite, metacognitive prompt, layer ref. Ensure progressive complexity, voter priorities (pedagogy, completeness, scaffolding), and no criminal assistance. Output only the JSON array.
